label: Target Mapping
description: Maps protein names or biological descriptions to assay metrics. Supports manual free-text input or automated lookup. Rationale: These proteins represent primary sensory interaction points where fragrance molecules are detected and encoded. The desired modulation profile favors smooth, low-arousal sensory signals that support a calming experience.

defaultInputs.name: Effect + Use Pathway
defaultInputs.tooltip: Input describing the desired effect and use pathway (e.g., "Stress-reducing / calming sensory experience for fragrance").

defaultOutputs.name: Protein_target
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Protein target name or biological process (e.g. "OR1A1", "OR2J3", "TRPM8", "TRPV3").

defaultOutputs.name: Biological_system
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Biological system or rationale explaining why this target is relevant to the intended effect (e.g. "Olfactory", "Trigeminal").

defaultOutputs.name: Desired _modulation
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Required modulation type: "activation" or "inhibition" for protein targets, or "N/A" for non-protein assays (e.g. safety, biology, stability).

defaultOutputs.name: Corresponding_assay
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Specific assay method used to measure the target or biological effect (e.g. "calcium imaging", "patch clamp", "kinase ATP assay").

defaultOutputs.name: Metric_used
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Measurement unit or metric for the assay result (e.g. "EC50", "IC50", "% viability", "mm", "MIC (Âµg/mL)").

defaultOutputs.name: Rationale
defaultOutputs.tooltip: Overall rationale explaining the target selection strategy and modulation profile for the specified effect and use pathway.

defaultOutputs.name: Crystalized_structure_available?
defaultOutputs.tooltip: If value is "N/A", displays as text. If value is a PDB ID or structure URL, displays as 3D structure viewer.

defaultOutputs.name: ChemBL_ID
defaultOutputs.tooltip: ChEMBL database identifier for the protein target (e.g., "CHEMBL1234"). May be "N/A" for non-protein targets or assays.

configSchema.label: Effect + Use Pathway
configSchema.placeholder: Enter desired effect and use pathway (e.g., "Stress-reducing, calming sensory experience for fragrance")
configSchema.tooltip: Describe the desired effect and use pathway. This will be used to generate appropriate target mappings and rationale.

mappingTable.Corresponding_assay: Cell-based olfactory receptor assay (HEK293, cAMP or Ca2+ readout)
mappingTable.Rationale: OR1A1 responds to soft, pleasant odorants. Moderate activation supports smooth, familiar odor perception linked to reduced emotional arousal.

mappingTable.Corresponding_assay: Heterologous OR expression assay with reporter gene
mappingTable.Rationale: OR2J3 is associated with fresh/green odor notes. Balanced activation contributes to emotional lightness without overstimulation.
Gentle TRPM8 engagement produces cooling and freshness that can bias autonomic tone toward relaxation when intensity is controlled.
TRPV3 contributes to warmth and comfort cues. Mild modulation supports safety and coziness rather than alertness.
